Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Latarcin 3b (Latarcin-3b, Ltc3b, Ltc 3b, XXA, BBMm; natural AMPs; spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: C-terminal NH2 is important for antimicrobial activity.

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli DH5alpha, E. coli DH1 (MIC 23-28 uM), P-aeruginosa (MIC>45 uM), Gram+ A. globiformis, B. subtilis (MIC 0.7-2.9 uM), yeasts P. pastoris, S. cerevisiae (MIC 23 uM).Toxicity:  Rabbit erythrocytes (20% lysis): >120 uM, HC50>100 uM, poor hemolytic. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Kozlov SA, Vassilevski AA, Feofanov AV, Surovoy AY, Karpunin DV, Grishin EV.2006
Literature Information.Title: Latarcins, antimicrobial and cytolytic peptides from the venom of the spider Lachesana tarabaevi (Zodariidae) that exemplify biomolecular diversity.
